column4: if I have a package, and it has tons of file, how can I find a particular function in that package?
grep or find? or something like that?
so I cd in the folder right
coz I have irssi source downlodae
I wanna know how to handle the command privmsg
try running this in irssi's source directory: grep -nHR "function-name" .
no, but you will need them if what you are searching for contains spaces
although you could use -inHR instead of -nHR to make it case-insensitive
did you include the . at the end of the command?
that was necessary.  Hit ctrl+C then do grep -nHR PRIVMSG .
also, if you want to know how the irc protocol works, you may want to look at http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1459
2812 has some elements which only apply to IRCnet and its ircd but not to other networks and ircds
